body: @panbhatt we did some mock test to see whether crash reports are generating. we are able to generate them. will upload a git sample so you could test see if it  works.

Check this out https://github.com/kamesh-a/electron-samples/tree/master/CrashReporter
sample log in mac, windows8 also we tested
Spec :

node --version : v2.3.3 ( iojs )
npm --version : 2.11.3

node 12.7 has same module version should be equivalent to this version.

Hope this helps !!!

@kamesh-a Tried to clone your repo and start it with "electron ." . sorry to say it is not working. here is my env details
npm : 2.11.3
node : V0.12.7

Errror while starting the program> 

[87248:0805/113829:ERROR:crash_reporter_win.cc(75)] Cannot initialize out-of-process crash handler
[96688:0805/113830:INFO:renderer_main.cc(200)] Renderer process started
[71596:0805/113830:INFO:renderer_main.cc(200)] Renderer process started

on click on Crash in the HTML window i receive the following. 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1473470/9090107/95c54a36-3b66-11e5-9a90-348e444ff612.png)

I am running windows 8.1. seems like there is some problem in starting CRASH HANDLER whilethe app is start. or may be i am doing something which is wrong here.

I'm also having problems with the crash-reporter on Windows. I tried both Windows 10 and Windows 7 with node v0.12.7 + electron v0.32.2 and the simple `crash-reporter-test` gist: https://gist.github.com/zcbenz/9c75ccda4f925faf92ca.

The crash is not reported:

```
 node .\node_modules\electron-prebuilt\cli.js .
[1040:0914/154400:INFO:renderer_main.cc(200)] Renderer process started
```

Here's what it looks like when it does work with the same code and versions of node and electron on Mac:

```
node ./node_modules/electron-prebuilt/cli.js .
[6579:0914/153922:ERROR:file_io.cc(30)] read: expected 40, observed 0
[6583:0914/153922:INFO:renderer_main.cc(200)] Renderer process started
{ _companyName: 'GitHub, Inc',
  _productName: 'crash-reporter-test',
  _version: '',
  guid: '0045a572-db57-45fc-9abd-d4eff6ea4536',
  platform: 'darwin',
  process_type: 'renderer',
  prod: 'Electron',
  ver: '0.32.2' }
[0914/153923:ERROR:http_transport_mac.mm(186)] The network connection was lost. (NSURLErrorDomain -1005)
```

Ok, so after looking at the `crash-reporter` code, it looks like this is user error on my part. On Windows the crash reporter [spawns a new process based on the path of the original process](https://github.com/atom/electron/blob/cd1c331112360ded924830bcc07ab54ccaff9207/atom/common/api/lib/crash-reporter.coffee#L38), so you shouldn't run electron with [node `cli.js`](https://github.com/mafintosh/electron-prebuilt/blob/master/cli.js) that comes with `electron-prebuilt`.

When I use the `electron.exe` executable, crash reports work. @panbhatt You might want to see if you were doing the same thing I was.

Ok, some more debugging... The [32-bit version](https://github.com/atom/electron/releases/download/v0.32.2/electron-v0.32.2-win32-ia32.zip) works, but not the [64-bit version](https://github.com/atom/electron/releases/download/v0.32.2/electron-v0.32.2-win32-x64.zip).

Also, despite what the [documentation says](https://github.com/atom/electron/blob/ae776b523c94091f10c159fb8ae3c4233aae3388/docs/api/crash-reporter.md#crashreporterstartoptions), you need to start crash-reporter in the renderer process on Windows too.
Appears that the crash reporter being broken on 64-bit windows is a known issue: https://github.com/atom/electron/blob/f1787d747afbfcc9e6c416b298d7bf32a366241d/spec/api-crash-reporter-spec.coffee#L19
Reopening this since is broken again after the upgrade to Chrome 50.
